Pan con Tomate  Ingredients: o 1 baguette o 4 tomatoes o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Rub toasted bread with cut garlic cloves. o Grate tomatoes and spread on bread. o Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. o Serve immediately. Paneer Tikka  Ingredients: o 1 pound paneer o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1 tablespoon lemon juice o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o Skewers  Instructions: o Cut paneer into cubes. o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, and salt in a bowl. o Add paneer cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour. o Thread paneer onto skewers. o Grill or broil until golden, turning occasionally. o Serve warm. Panzanella  Ingredients: o 4 cups cubed bread o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Toast bread cubes until golden. o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and chopped basil. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Papadum  Ingredients: o 1 cup urad dal flour o 1/4 cup water o 1/2 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix urad dal flour, water, and salt to form a dough. o Roll dough into thin circles. o Fry in hot oil until crispy. o Drain on paper towels and serve. Patatas Bravas  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/2 cup tomato sauce o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup mayonnaise  Instructions: o Peel and dice potatoes. o Toss potatoes with olive oil and salt, then roast at 400°F (200°C) until crispy. o Mix tomato sauce, paprika, and cayenne pepper in a bowl. o Serve potatoes with tomato sauce and a dollop of mayonnaise. Pepper Pot  Ingredients: o 1 pound beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 cups beef broth o 1 cup spinach o 1 cup okra o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Sauté diced beef, onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add beef broth, thyme, salt, and pepper, simmer for 1 hour. o Stir in spinach and okra, cook until tender. o Serve warm. Peri-Peri Chicken  Ingredients: o 1 pound chicken thighs o 1/4 cup peri-peri sauce o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Marinate chicken in peri-peri sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper for at least 1 hour. o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked through. o Serve warm. Pico de Gallo  Ingredients: o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 jalapeño o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 lime o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dice tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño. o Chop cilantro. o Combine all ingredients in a bowl. o Squeeze lime juice over the mixture and add salt. o Mix well and serve. Pimientos de Padrón  Ingredients: o 1 pound Padrón peppers o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 teaspoon sea salt  Instructions: o Heat olive oil in a pan. o Add Padrón peppers and sauté until blistered and tender. o Sprinkle with sea salt and serve warm. Plantain Chips  Ingredients: o 2 green plantains o 1 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Peel and slice plantains thinly. o Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until crispy. o Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt. o Serve warm. Polenta  Ingredients: o 1 cup cornmeal o 4 cups water o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons butter o 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese  Instructions: o Bring water and salt to a boil. o Gradually whisk in cornmeal. o Reduce heat and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened (about 30 minutes). o Stir in butter and Parmesan cheese. o Serve warm. Potato Salad  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 2 eggs o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup mayonnaise o 2 tablespoons mustard o 1 tablespoon vinegar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice. o Hard-boil eggs, then chop. o Mix potatoes, eggs, diced onion, mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper. o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Pretzels  Ingredients: o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 3 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup baking soda o 1 egg o Coarse salt  Instructions: o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into pieces and roll into ropes, then shape into pretzels. o Boil water with baking soda and dip pretzels in the solution. o Place on a baking sheet, brush with beaten egg, and sprinkle with coarse salt. o Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 12-15 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Pulao  Ingredients: o 1 cup basmati rice o 2 cups water o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1/2 cup peas o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons oil  Instructions: o Rinse rice and soak in water for 30 minutes. o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion until translucent. o Add diced carrot, peas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute. o Drain rice and add to the pan, stir to coat with spices. o Add water and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water is absorbed. o Add salt to taste and serve. Quesadillas  Ingredients: o 4 flour tortillas o 2 cups shredded cheese o 1/2 cup diced cooked chicken (optional) o 1/4 cup chopped cilantro o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions: o Heat oil in a pan. o Place a tortilla in the pan and sprinkle with cheese, chicken, and cilantro. o Top with another tortilla. o Cook until cheese is melted and tortilla is golden, then flip and cook the other side. o Cut into wedges and serve. Quiche Lorraine  Ingredients: o 1 pie crust o 6 slices bacon o 1 small onion o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese o 3 eggs o 1 cup heavy cream o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Place pie crust in a pie dish and sprinkle with bacon, onion, and cheese. o Beat eggs with cream, salt, and pepper, then pour over the filling. o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. o Serve warm. Quindim  Ingredients: o 2 cups sugar o 1 cup coconut o 1/4 cup butter o 10 egg yolks o 1 teaspoon vanilla extract  Instructions: o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Mix sugar, coconut, melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla extract in a bowl. o Pour mixture into greased muffin tins. o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. o Let cool before removing from tins. o Serve chilled. Raita  Ingredients: o 1 cup yogurt o 1/2 cucumber o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 teaspoon cumin o 1/4 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture. o Mix yogurt with cucumber, chopped mint, cumin, and salt. o Serve chilled. Ratatouille  Ingredients: o 1 eggplant o 1 zucchini o 1 bell pepper o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon rosemary o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dice eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, and tomatoes. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, tomatoes, thyme, rosemary, and salt. o Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. o Serve warm. Rau Muong Xao Toi (Stir-Fried Morning Glory with Garlic)  Ingredients: o 1 pound morning glory o 4 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions: o Sauté minced garlic in vegetable oil until fragrant. o Add morning glory and stir-fry until tender. o Add fish sauce and cook for 2 minutes. o Serve warm. Refried Beans  Ingredients: o 2 cups cooked pinto beans o 1/4 cup lard or vegetable oil o 1 small onion o 1 clove garlic o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Heat lard or oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add beans and mash with a potato masher. o Cook, stirring frequently, until beans are thickened. o Add salt to taste and serve. Rfissa  Ingredients: o 1 pound chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon ginger o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/4 cup lentils o 1/4 cup cilantro o 4 pieces flatbread  Instructions: o Sauté chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic in olive oil until browned. o Add cumin, turmeric, ginger, and salt, cook for 1 minute. o Add chicken broth and lentils, simmer until chicken is cooked and lentils are tender. o Stir in chopped cilantro. o Tear flatbread into pieces and place in a serving dish. o Pour chicken and sauce over the bread and serve warm. Rice and Peas  Ingredients: o 1 cup rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1 cup water o 1/2 cup kidney beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add rice, coconut milk, water, kidney beans, thyme, and salt. o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm. Rillettes  Ingredients: o 1 pound pork shoulder o 1/2 cup duck fat o 1/4 cup white wine o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Cut pork into small pieces. o Cook pork with duck fat, wine, thyme, salt, and pepper in a pot over low heat until very tender (about 3 hours). o Shred pork with a fork and pack into jars. o Chill until set. o Serve with bread. Risotto  Ingredients: o 1 cup Arborio rice o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup white wine o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese o 2 tablespoons butter o 1 tablespoon olive oil  Instructions: o Heat broth in a pot and keep warm. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until translucent. o Add rice and cook until lightly toasted. o Pour in wine and cook until absorbed. o Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed. o Continue until rice is creamy and tender. o Stir in butter and grated Parmesan cheese. o Serve immediately. Rösti (Potato Pancakes)  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup flour o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Grate potatoes and onion, then squeeze out excess moisture. o Mix with flour, beaten egg, salt, and pepper. o Form mixture into patties. o Fry in hot oil until golden on both sides. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Rotkohl (Braised Red Cabbage)  Ingredients: o 1 head red cabbage o 1 small onion o 1 apple o 1/4 cup vinegar o 1/4 cup sugar o 1/4 cup water o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Shred cabbage and slice onion and apple. o Sauté onion in a pot until softened. o Add cabbage, apple, vinegar, sugar, water, salt, and pepper. o Simmer for 45 minutes until cabbage is tender. o Serve warm. Saganaki  Ingredients: o 1/2 pound kefalotyri cheese o 1/4 cup flour o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 lemon  Instructions: o Cut cheese into slices. o Dredge cheese in flour. o Heat olive oil in a pan and fry cheese until golden on both sides. o Squeeze lemon juice over the top and serve immediately. Salade Niçoise  Ingredients: o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup green beans o 2 hard-boiled eggs o 1 can tuna o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Blanch green beans until tender. o Arrange tomatoes, cucumber, onion, green beans, olives, and tuna on a plate. o Quarter hard-boiled eggs and add to the salad. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, mustard, and salt, then drizzle over the salad. o Toss gently and serve. Salpicão  Ingredients: o 2 cups shredded chicken o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 apple o 1/4 cup raisins o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dice onion, grate carrot, and chop apple. o Mix shredded chicken with onion, carrot, apple, raisins, mayonnaise, chopped parsley, and salt. o Serve chilled. Saltfish Fritters  Ingredients: o 1 pound salted cod o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup flour o 1/4 cup water o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake. o Mix cod with diced onion, minced garlic, flour, water, thyme, and salt. o Form mixture into fritters. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Samosa  Ingredients: o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup oil o 1/2 cup water o 2 potatoes o 1/2 cup peas o 1 small onion o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix flour, oil, and water to form a dough, then let rest. o Boil and mash potatoes, then mix with peas, diced onion, and spices. o Roll dough into circles, cut in half, and form cones. o Fill cones with potato mixture and seal edges. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Serve warm. Satay  Ingredients: o 1 pound chicken breast o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons peanut butter o 1 tablespoon curry powder o 1 tablespoon brown sugar o Skewers  Instructions: o Cut chicken into strips and thread onto skewers. o Mix coconut milk, soy sauce, peanut butter, curry powder, and brown sugar in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 1 hour. o Grill or broil until cooked through. o Serve with peanut sauce. Sauerkraut  Ingredients: o 1 head cabbage o 1 tablespoon sea salt o 1 teaspoon caraway seeds  Instructions: o Shred cabbage and mix with sea salt and caraway seeds. o Pack cabbage into a jar and press down to release juices. o Cover and let ferment at room temperature for 1-2 weeks. o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. Shakshuka  Ingredients: o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 4 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 4 eggs o 1/4 cup parsley  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. o Cover and cook until eggs are set. o Garnish with chopped parsley and serve. Shawarma  Ingredients: o 1 pound chicken thighs o 1/4 cup yogurt o 2 tablespoons lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 2 hours. o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked through. o Slice and serve with pita bread and toppings. Skordalia  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 4 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Boil potatoes until tender, then mash. o Blend mashed potatoes with minced garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and salt until smooth. o Serve as a dip or side dish. Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)  Ingredients: o 1 green papaya o 2 tomatoes o 1 carrot o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon peanuts o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions: o Peel and shred green papaya and carrot. o Crush garlic and chilies in a mortar and pestle. o Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar, mix well. o Toss shredded papaya, carrot, and sliced tomatoes with the dressing. o Garnish with crushed peanuts and serve. Sopa de Tortilla  Ingredients: o 4 corn tortillas o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 cups chicken broth o 2 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 avocado o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions: o Cut tortillas into strips and fry in oil until crispy. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in a pot until translucent. o Add diced tomatoes and cumin, cook for 5 minutes. o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Serve soup topped with tortilla strips, diced avocado, and chopped cilantro.

 Ingredients: o 2 cups black-eyed peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Soak black-eyed peas overnight, then peel and rinse. o Blend peas with diced onion, minced garlic, and salt until smooth. o Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Agedashi Tofu  Ingredients: o 1 block tofu o 1/4 cup cornstarch o 1 cup dashi broth o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon mirin o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup grated daikon  Instructions: o Cut tofu into cubes and coat with cornstarch. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Heat dashi broth with soy sauce and mirin. o Serve tofu in broth, topped with green onions and grated daikon. Aloo Gobi  Ingredients: o 2 potatoes o 1 cauliflower o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons oil  Instructions: o Peel and dice potatoes, cut cauliflower into florets. o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add cumin, turmeric, coriander, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute. o Add potatoes and cauliflower, stir to coat with spices. o Cover and cook until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. o Add salt to taste and serve. Albondigas  Ingredients: o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 cup tomato sauce  Instructions: o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat olive oil in a pan and brown meatballs on all sides. o Add tomato sauce and simmer for 20 minutes. o Serve warm. Antipasto  Ingredients: o Assorted cured meats (salami, prosciutto) o Cheeses (mozzarella, provolone) o Olives o Marinated vegetables (artichokes, peppers) o Breadsticks  Instructions: o Arrange meats, cheeses, olives, and vegetables on a platter. o Serve with breadsticks. Arancini  Ingredients: o 2 cups cooked risotto o 1/2 cup mozzarella o 1/2 cup flour o 2 eggs o 1 cup breadcrumbs o 1 cup vegetable oil  Instructions: o Form risotto into balls and stuff with a cube of mozzarella. o Dredge balls in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Baba Ganoush  Ingredients: o 2 eggplants o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash. o Blend mashed eggplant, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Baked Beans  Ingredients: o 4 cups cooked navy beans o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup molasses o 1/4 cup brown sugar o 1/4 cup ketchup o 1 tablespoon mustard o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Sauté diced onion until translucent. o Mix beans, onion, molasses, brown sugar, ketchup, mustard, salt, and pepper in a baking dish. o Bake for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. o Serve warm. Bammy  Ingredients: o 2 cups grated cassava o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix grated cassava with coconut milk and salt. o Form mixture into flat cakes. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Banchan  Ingredients: o Assorted small side dishes like pickled radish, spinach, bean sprouts, kimchi  Instructions: o Prepare each side dish separately. o Arrange on small plates. o Serve as accompaniments to the main meal. Banh Beo  Ingredients: o 1 cup rice flour o 1/2 cup water o 1/2 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup shrimp o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup fried shallots o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon sugar  Instructions: o Mix rice flour, water, coconut milk, salt, and sugar to form a batter. o Pour batter into small dishes and steam until set. o Sauté chopped shrimp and green onions until cooked. o Top steamed cakes with shrimp, green onions, and fried shallots. o Serve with dipping sauce. Banh Xeo  Ingredients: o 1 cup rice flour o 1/2 cup coconut milk o 1/2 cup water o 1/2 pound shrimp o 1/2 pound pork o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix rice flour, coconut milk, water, turmeric, and salt to form a batter. o Sauté sliced pork, shrimp, and diced onion until cooked. o Heat oil in a pan and pour in a ladle of batter, swirling to coat the pan. o Add cooked pork, shrimp, bean sprouts, green onions, and cilantro. o Fold pancake in half and cook until crispy. o Serve with lettuce and dipping sauce. Basturma  Ingredients: o 1 pound beef tenderloin o 1/4 cup paprika o 2 tablespoons cumin o 2 tablespoons fenugreek o 1 tablespoon garlic powder o 1 tablespoon salt  Instructions: o Rub beef with salt and let cure in the refrigerator for 24 hours. o Rinse and pat dry. o Mix paprika, cumin, fenugreek, and garlic powder, then coat beef with the mixture. o Wrap in cheesecloth and hang in a cool, dry place for 1-2 weeks. o Slice thinly and serve. Batbout  Ingredients: o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 3 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions: o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until puffed and golden. o Serve warm. Bhindi Masala  Ingredients: o 1 pound okra o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons oil  Instructions: o Wash and dry okra, then cut into pieces. o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute. o Add okra and stir to coat with spices. o Cook until okra is tender, stirring occasionally. o Add salt to taste and serve. Bobotie  Ingredients: o 1 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup raisins o 1/4 cup almonds o 1 tablespoon curry powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 2 eggs o 1/2 cup milk o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs  Instructions: o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add ground beef, raisins, almonds, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook until beef is browned. o Transfer mixture to a baking dish. o Beat eggs with milk and pour over the beef mixture. o Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. o Bake for 30 minutes until set and golden. o Serve warm. Bok Choy with Garlic  Ingredients: o 1 pound bok choy o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  Instructions: o Sauté minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. o Add bok choy and stir-fry until tender. o Add soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes. o Serve warm. Bolinho de Bacalhau  Ingredients: o 1 pound salted cod o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 2 eggs o 1 cup breadcrumbs o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake. o Boil potatoes until tender, then mash. o Mix cod with mashed potatoes, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, and beaten eggs. o Form mixture into balls and coat with breadcrumbs. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Bouillabaisse  Ingredients: o 1 pound fish fillets o 1/2 pound shrimp o 1/2 pound mussels o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 4 cups fish stock o 1/2 cup white wine o 1 teaspoon saffron o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, fish stock, wine, saffron, thyme, salt, and pepper, simmer for 20 minutes. o Add fish fillets, shrimp, and mussels, cook until seafood is done. o Serve hot with crusty bread. Bratkartoffeln (Fried Potatoes)  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup bacon o 2 tablespoons butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Boil potatoes until tender, then slice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté sliced potatoes and diced onion in butter until golden. o Stir in bacon, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm. Briam  Ingredients: o 2 potatoes o 2 zucchinis o 2 eggplants o 2 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 4 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Slice potatoes, zucchinis, eggplants, and tomatoes. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Layer vegetables in a baking dish, seasoning with oregano, salt, and pepper. o Pour sautéed onion and garlic over the top. o Bake for 45 minutes until vegetables are tender. o Serve warm. Briouats  Ingredients: o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon cinnamon o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 1 package phyllo dough o 1/4 cup butter o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Stir in chopped parsley, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. o Cut phyllo dough into strips and brush with melted butter. o Place a spoonful of filling on each strip and fold into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Bruschetta  Ingredients: o 1 baguette o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup basil o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Dice tomatoes and chop basil. o Mix tomatoes, basil, minced garlic, olive oil, and salt. o Spoon mixture onto toasted bread and serve. Bulgur Pilaf  Ingredients: o 1 cup bulgur o 2 cups chicken broth o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1/4 cup parsley o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion and grated carrot in olive oil until softened. o Add bulgur and cook for 2 minutes. o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until bulgur is tender. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm. Ca Tim Nuong (Grilled Eggplant)  Ingredients: o 2 eggplants o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 1 tablespoon lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions: o Grill eggplants until charred and tender. o Peel and slice eggplants. o Mix minced garlic, fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar in a bowl. o Toss eggplants with the dressing. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve. Callaloo  Ingredients: o 1 pound callaloo leaves o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add callaloo leaves and cook until wilted. o Stir in coconut milk, thyme, salt, and pepper. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Serve warm. Canh Chua  Ingredients: o 4 cups fish stock o 1/2 pound fish fillets o 1 cup pineapple o 1 cup tomatoes o 1 cup bean sprouts o 2 stalks lemongrass o 2-3 Thai chilies o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions: o Bring fish stock to a boil. o Add lemongrass, chilies, and tamarind paste, simmer for 10 minutes. o Add pineapple, tomatoes, and fish fillets, cook until fish is done. o Stir in fish sauce, sugar, and bean sprouts. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve. Caprese Salad  Ingredients: o 4 tomatoes o 1 pound fresh mozzarella o 1/4 cup basil o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Slice tomatoes and mozzarella. o Arrange on a plate, alternating slices. o Sprinkle with chopped basil, olive oil, balsamic glaze, and salt. o Serve immediately. Carrot Salad  Ingredients: o 4 carrots o 1/4 cup raisins o 1/4 cup parsley o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Grate carrots and mix with raisins and chopped parsley. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve chilled. Ceviche  Ingredients: o 1 pound fresh fish or shrimp o 1 cup lime juice o 1 small onion o 2 tomatoes o 1 jalapeño o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dice fish or shrimp and place in a bowl. o Pour lime juice over the seafood and let marinate for 30 minutes. o Dice onion, tomatoes, and jalapeño. o Chop cilantro. o Mix all ingredients together and add salt. o Serve chilled. Cha Gio  Ingredients: o 1 package spring roll wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup shrimp o 1/2 cup mushrooms o 1/4 cup carrots o 1/4 cup green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix ground pork, chopped shrimp, diced mushrooms, julienned carrots, chopped green onions, minced garlic, fish sauce, and sugar in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce. Chakchouka  Ingredients: o 4 tomatoes o 2 bell peppers o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 4 eggs o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell peppers in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. o Cover and cook until eggs are set. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm. Chana Masala  Ingredients: o 2 cups cooked chickpeas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1 can diced tomatoes o 2 tablespoons oil  Instructions: o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add cumin, coriander, garam masala, and turmeric, cook for 1 minute. o Add chickpeas and diced tomatoes, stir to combine. o Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. o Add salt to taste and serve. Chapati  Ingredients: o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup oil o 1/2 cup water o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Mix flour, oil, water, and salt to form a dough, then let rest. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. o Serve warm. Char Siu  Ingredients: o 1 pound pork shoulder o 1/4 cup hoisin sauce o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons honey o 1 tablespoon rice wine o 1 teaspoon five-spice powder o 1 teaspoon garlic powder  Instructions: o Mix hoisin sauce, soy sauce, honey, rice wine, five-spice powder, and garlic powder in a bowl. o Marinate pork in the mixture for at least 2 hours. o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Place pork on a baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes, basting occasionally. o Let rest before slicing and serving. Chawanmushi  Ingredients: o 2 eggs o 1 cup dashi broth o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 tablespoon mirin o 1/4 cup chicken o 1/4 cup shrimp o 1/4 cup mushrooms  Instructions: o Beat eggs with dashi broth, soy sauce, and mirin. o Place chicken, shrimp, and mushrooms in small bowls. o Pour egg mixture over the top. o Steam for 15 minutes until set. o Serve warm. Chiles Rellenos  Ingredients: o 4 poblano peppers o 1 cup shredded cheese o 1/2 cup flour o 4 eggs o 1 cup vegetable oil o 1 cup tomato sauce  Instructions: o Roast peppers until charred, then peel and remove seeds. o Stuff peppers with cheese. o Separate eggs and beat whites until stiff, then fold in yolks. o Dredge peppers in flour, then dip in egg mixture. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Serve with warmed tomato sauce.

 Return chicken to the skillet and cook until heated through.  Serve warm. Peking Duck Ingredients:  1 whole duck  1/4 cup soy sauce  1/4 cup honey  2 tablespoons hoisin sauce  2 tablespoons rice vinegar  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 teaspoon five-spice powder  1 teaspoon grated ginger  1/4 cup green onions, sliced  Mandarin pancakes for serving Instructions:  Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, minced garlic, five-spice powder, and grated ginger.  Brush the mixture over the duck.  Place duck on a roasting rack and roast for 1 hour and 30 minutes until skin is crispy.  Let rest before carving.  Serve duck with sliced green onions and mandarin pancakes. Pork Schnitzel Ingredients:  4 pork cutlets  1/2 cup flour  2 eggs, beaten  1 cup breadcrumbs  1/4 cup vegetable oil  1 lemon, sliced  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper.  Dredge cutlets in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.  In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.  Cook cutlets until golden and crispy on both sides.  Serve with lemon slices. Quiche Lorraine Ingredients:  1 pie crust  6 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled  1 small onion, diced  1 cup grated Gruyère cheese  3 eggs  1 cup heavy cream  1/2 teaspoon salt  1/4 teaspoon pepper Instructions:  Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  Place pie crust in a pie dish.  Sprinkle cooked bacon, diced onion, and grated Gruyère cheese over the crust.  In a bowl, whisk eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper.  Pour egg mixture over the filling.  Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden.  Serve warm. Ramen Ingredients:  4 cups chicken broth  1/4 cup soy sauce  2 tablespoons miso paste  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 piece ginger, sliced  1/2 pound pork belly, sliced  4 eggs, soft-boiled  8 ounces ramen noodles  Sliced green onions, nori, and sesame seeds for garnish Instructions:  In a large pot, bring chicken broth, soy sauce, miso paste, minced garlic, and sliced ginger to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.  In a skillet, cook sliced pork belly until crispy.  Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions.  Divide noodles among bowls, top with broth, pork belly, soft-boiled eggs, sliced green onions, nori, and sesame seeds.  Serve immediately. Roast Beef Ingredients:  1 beef roast (3-4 pounds)  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped  1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped  1/4 cup olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).  In a bowl, mix minced garlic, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, olive oil, salt, and pepper.  Rub the mixture over the beef roast.  Place the roast in a roasting pan and cook for 1 hour and 30 minutes until desired doneness.  Let rest before slicing and serving. Salmon en Papillote Ingredients:  4 salmon fillets  1 lemon, sliced  1 small onion, sliced  1 zucchini, sliced  1/4 cup olive oil  1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped  Salt and pepper to taste  Parchment paper Instructions:  Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  Cut parchment paper into large squares.  Place a salmon fillet in the center of each square.  Top with lemon slices, sliced onion, and sliced zucchini.  Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with chopped dill, salt, and pepper.  Fold the parchment paper over the salmon and seal the edges to form a packet.  Place packets on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until salmon is cooked through.  Serve warm.

 1 teaspoon thyme  1 teaspoon rosemary  1/4 cup olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  In a large baking dish, layer diced eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, onion, and tomatoes.  In a bowl, mix minced garlic, olive oil, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper.  Pour the mixture over the vegetables and toss to coat.  Bake for 45 minutes until vegetables are tender.  Serve warm. Roast Chicken Ingredients:  1 whole chicken  1 lemon, halved  4 cloves garlic, minced  1/4 cup olive oil  1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped  1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  Season the chicken with salt and pepper.  Stuff the cavity with lemon halves and minced garlic.  In a bowl, mix olive oil, chopped rosemary, and chopped thyme.  Brush the mixture over the chicken.  Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour and 30 minutes until cooked through.  Let rest before carving and serving. Shrimp and Grits Ingredients:  1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined  1 cup grits  4 cups water  1/2 cup cheddar cheese, shredded  1/4 cup butter  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1/4 cup bacon, chopped  1/4 cup green onions, sliced  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  In a pot, bring water to a boil and stir in grits.  Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, then stir in shredded cheddar cheese and butter.  In a skillet, cook chopped bacon until crispy, then set aside.  In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.  Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque.  Stir in cooked bacon and sliced green onions.  Serve shrimp mixture over grits. Spaghetti Carbonara Ingredients:  1 pound spaghetti  4 eggs  1 cup grated Parmesan cheese  1/2 cup pancetta, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1/4 cup heavy cream (optional)  Salt and pepper to taste  Chopped parsley for garnish Instructions:  Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.  In a skillet, cook diced pancetta until crispy, then set aside.  In a bowl, whisk eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and heavy cream (if using).  In the same skillet, sauté minced garlic until fragrant.  Add cooked spaghetti and toss to coat.  Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, pancetta, salt, and pepper.  Garnish with chopped parsley and serve. Stuffed Bell Peppers Ingredients:  4 bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed  1 pound ground beef  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup cooked rice  1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes  1 cup shredded cheese  1 teaspoon oregano  1 teaspoon basil  2 tablespoons olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste Sweet and Sour Pork Ingredients:  1 pound pork tenderloin, cubed  1 bell pepper, diced  1 small onion, diced  1/2 cup pineapple chunks  1/4 cup ketchup  1/4 cup rice vinegar  1/4 cup soy sauce  1/4 cup brown sugar  2 tablespoons cornstarch  2 tablespoons vegetable oil  Cooked rice for serving Instructions:  In a bowl, toss pork cubes with cornstarch.  Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.  Cook pork until browned and crispy, then set aside.  In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and bell pepper until softened.  Stir in pineapple chunks, ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and brown sugar.  Return pork to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.  Serve over cooked rice. Tandoori Chicken Ingredients:  4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs  1 cup yogurt  2 tablespoons lemon juice  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 teaspoon grated ginger  1 teaspoon cumin  1 teaspoon coriander  1 teaspoon turmeric  1 teaspoon paprika  1 teaspoon garam masala  1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, grated ginger, cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, garam masala, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.  Marinate chicken thighs in the mixture for at least 1 hour.  Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).  Place chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes until cooked through.  Serve warm. Thai Green Curry Ingredients:  1 pound chicken breast, cubed  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 bell pepper, sliced  1 cup coconut milk  1/2 cup chicken broth  2 tablespoons green curry paste  1 tablespoon fish sauce  1 tablespoon brown sugar  1/4 cup fresh basil leaves  2 tablespoons vegetable oil  Cooked rice for serving Instructions:  In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.  Cook diced onion and minced garlic until softened.  Add cubed chicken and cook until browned.  Stir in green curry paste, coconut milk, chicken broth, fish sauce, and brown sugar.  Add sliced bell pepper and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through.  Stir in fresh basil leaves.  Serve over cooked rice. Turkey Meatballs Ingredients:  1 pound ground turkey  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1/4 cup breadcrumbs  1 egg, beaten  1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese  1 teaspoon oregano  1 teaspoon basil  Salt and pepper to taste  2 tablespoons olive oil  1 jar (24 ounces) marinara sauce Instructions:  In a bowl, mix ground turkey, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, grated Parmesan cheese, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.  Form mixture into meatballs.  In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.  Cook meatballs until browned on all sides.  Add marinara sauce and simmer for 20 minutes until meatballs are cooked through.  Serve warm. Vegetable Stir-Fry Ingredients:  1 cup broccoli florets  1 cup bell peppers, sliced  1 cup snow peas  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  2 tablespoons soy sauce  1 tablespoon oyster sauce  1 tablespoon sesame oil  1 teaspoon cornstarch  1/4 cup water  Cooked rice for serving Instructions:  In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, and water.  In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat.  Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until fragrant.  Add broccoli, bell peppers, and snow peas, stir-fry until tender.  Pour sauce over the vegetables and cook until thickened.  Serve over cooked rice. Vietnamese Pho Ingredients:  1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced  8 cups beef broth  1 small onion, sliced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 piece ginger, sliced  2 star anise  1 cinnamon stick  1 tablespoon fish sauce  1 tablespoon soy sauce  8 ounces rice noodles  Fresh basil, cilantro, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and sliced jalapeños for garnish Instructions:  In a large pot, bring beef broth to a boil.  Add sliced onion, minced garlic, sliced ginger, star anise, and cinnamon stick.  Simmer for 30 minutes.  Stir in fish sauce and soy sauce.  Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.  Divide noodles and thinly sliced beef among bowls.  Pour hot broth over the top.  Garnish with fresh basil, cilantro, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and sliced jalapeños.  Serve immediately. Yakitori Ingredients:  1 pound chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces  1/4 cup soy sauce  1/4 cup mirin  1/4 cup sake  2 tablespoons sugar  Bamboo skewers  Sliced green onions for garnish Instructions:  In a bowl, mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar.  Marinate chicken pieces in the mixture for at least 30 minutes.  Thread chicken onto bamboo skewers.  Preheat grill to medium-high heat.  Grill chicken, brushing with marinade, until cooked through.  Garnish with sliced green onions and serve. Zucchini Noodles with Pesto Ingredients:  4 zucchinis, spiralized into noodles  1/2 cup basil pesto  1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved  1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese  2 tablespoons olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:  In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.  Add zucchini noodles and cook until tender.  Stir in basil pesto and cherry tomatoes.  Season with salt and pepper.  Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve. Beef and Broccoli Ingredients:  1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced  2 cups broccoli florets  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1/4 cup soy sauce  1/4 cup beef broth  2 tablespoons oyster sauce  1 tablespoon cornstarch  2 tablespoons vegetable oil  Cooked rice for serving Instructions:  In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, beef broth, oyster sauce, and cornstarch.  In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.  Cook sliced beef until browned, then set aside.  In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until fragrant.  Add broccoli florets and stir-fry until tender.  Return beef to the skillet and pour sauce over the top.  Cook until sauce is thickened.  Serve over cooked rice. Chicken Fajitas Ingredients:  1 pound chicken breast, sliced  1 bell pepper, sliced  1 small onion, sliced  2 tablespoons fajita seasoning  2 tablespoons vegetable oil  Tortillas for serving  Shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa for toppings Instructions:  In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.  Cook sliced chicken, bell pepper, and onion until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.  Stir in fajita seasoning and cook for an additional 2 minutes.  Serve chicken and vegetables in tortillas with desired toppings. Chicken Piccata Ingredients:  4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts  1/4 cup flour  1/4 cup lemon juice  1/4 cup chicken broth  1/4 cup capers  2 tablespoons butter  2 tablespoons olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste  Chopped parsley for garnish Instructions:  Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour.  In a large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat.  Cook chicken until golden and cooked through, then set aside.  In the same skillet, add lemon juice, chicken broth, and capers, simmer until reduced by half.  Return chicken to the skillet and coat with the sauce.  Garnish with chopped parsley and serve. Chicken Pot Pie Ingredients:  1 pound chicken breast, cubed  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup frozen peas and carrots  1 cup chicken broth  1/2 cup milk  1/4 cup flour  1/4 cup butter  1 teaspoon thyme  1 teaspoon rosemary  Salt and pepper to taste  1 pie crust Instructions:  Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.  Cook diced onion and minced garlic until softened.  Add cubed chicken and cook until browned.  Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.  Gradually add chicken broth and milk, stirring constantly until thickened.  Add frozen peas and carrots, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper.  Pour mixture into a baking dish and top with pie crust.  Bake for 25-30 minutes until crust is golden.  Serve warm. Chicken Stir-Fry Ingredients:  1 pound chicken breast, sliced  1 cup broccoli florets  1 cup bell peppers, sliced  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  2 tablespoons soy sauce  1 tablespoon oyster sauce  1 tablespoon sesame oil  1 teaspoon cornstarch  1/4 cup water  Cooked rice for serving Instructions:  In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, and water.  In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat.  Cook sliced chicken until browned, then set aside.  In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until fragrant.  Add broccoli and bell peppers, stir-fry until tender.  Return chicken to the skillet and pour sauce over the top.  Cook until sauce is thickened.  Serve over cooked rice. Coq au Vin

o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, vegetable broth, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt. o Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender. o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. Horta  Ingredients: o 1 pound dandelion greens o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Boil dandelion greens until tender, then drain. o Toss greens with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve warm or chilled. Hot and Sour Soup  Ingredients: o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms o 1/4 cup bamboo shoots o 1/4 cup tofu o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons rice vinegar o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1 teaspoon chili paste o 1 egg o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions: o Bring chicken broth to a boil. o Add mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili paste. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the soup, stirring until thickened. o Beat egg and slowly pour into the soup, stirring constantly. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. Hummus  Ingredients: o 1 can chickpeas o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Japchae  Ingredients: o 8 ounces sweet potato noodles o 1/2 pound beef o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 bell pepper o 1 cup spinach o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions: o Cook noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté sliced beef, diced onion, julienned carrot, and bell pepper in sesame oil until cooked. o Add spinach and cook until wilted. o Mix noodles with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame seeds. o Combine with cooked beef and vegetables. o Serve warm. Jerk Vegetables  Ingredients: o 1 cup broccoli o 1 cup bell peppers o 1 cup zucchini o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons jerk seasoning o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions: o Toss vegetables with minced garlic, jerk seasoning, and olive oil. o Roast at 400°F (200°C) until tender. o Serve warm. Johnny Cakes  Ingredients: o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup butter o 1/2 cup milk o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. o Add milk and stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Jollof Rice  Ingredients: o 2 cups rice o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup tomato paste o 1/4 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon curry powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 4 cups chicken broth  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in vegetable oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook for 5 minutes. o Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm. Kachumbari  Ingredients: o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 cucumber o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dice tomatoes, onion, and cucumber. o Mix vegetables with chopped cilantro, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve chilled. Käsespätzle (Cheese Noodles)  Ingredients: o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup milk o 3 eggs o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg o 1/4 cup butter o 1 cup grated cheese o 1 small onion  Instructions: o Mix flour, milk, beaten eggs, salt, and nutmeg to form a batter. o Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into boiling water. o Cook until spaetzle floats to the surface, then drain. o Sauté sliced onion in butter until golden. o Layer spaetzle and grated cheese in a baking dish, top with sautéed onion. o Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. o Serve warm. Kartoffelsalat (Potato Salad)  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup bacon o 1/4 cup vinegar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon mustard o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Mix vinegar, chicken broth, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Combine potatoes, bacon, and onion with the dressing. o Serve warm or chilled. Keftedes  Ingredients: o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon mint o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, oregano, mint, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Kibbeh  Ingredients: o 1 cup bulgur o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup pine nuts o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon allspice o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Soak bulgur in water until tender, then drain. o Mix bulgur with ground beef, diced onion, pine nuts, cumin, allspice, and salt. o Form mixture into balls or patties. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve. Kimchi  Ingredients: o 1 napa cabbage o 1/4 cup sea salt o 1 tablespoon sugar o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 4 cloves garlic o 1 inch ginger o 4 green onions  Instructions: o Cut cabbage into quarters and soak in salted water for 2 hours. o Rinse and drain cabbage. o Mix sugar, fish sauce, gochugaru, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green onions in a bowl. o Rub mixture onto cabbage leaves. o Pack cabbage into a jar and let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days. o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. Kongnamul Muchim  Ingredients: o 1 pound soybean sprouts o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions: o Blanch soybean sprouts in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss sprouts with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Labneh  Ingredients: o 2 cups yogurt o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions: o Mix yogurt with salt. o Place yogurt in a cheesecloth-lined strainer over a bowl. o Let drain in the refrigerator for 24 hours. o Transfer labneh to a serving dish and drizzle with olive oil. o Serve with pita bread. Larb  Ingredients: o 1/2 pound ground chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon rice powder o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions: o Sauté ground chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and rice powder in a bowl. o Toss chicken with the dressing, chopped mint, cilantro, and sliced chilies. o Serve with lettuce leaves. Lo Mein  Ingredients: o 8 ounces lo mein noodles o 1 cup sliced bell peppers o 1 cup snow peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  Instructions: o Cook lo mein noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. o Add bell peppers and snow peas, stir-fry until tender. o Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce, stir to combine. o Serve warm. Loubia  Ingredients: o 2 cups white beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions: o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Mix beans with tomato sauce and cook for 10 minutes. o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. Macaroni and Cheese  Ingredients: o 2 cups elbow macaroni o 2 cups milk o 2 tablespoons butter o 2 tablespoons flour o 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Cook macaroni according to package instructions, then drain. o Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux. o Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened. o Add cheese, salt, and pepper, stir until melted. o Combine cheese sauce with macaroni. o Serve warm. Manakish  Ingredients: o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 3 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup za'atar  Instructions: o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Spread za'atar mixed with olive oil on top. o Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Mandazi  Ingredients: o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup water o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add coconut milk and water, stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Mandu  Ingredients: o 1 package dumpling wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 teaspoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions: o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce. Mango Sticky Rice  Ingredients: o 1 cup glutinous rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup sugar o 1/4 teaspoon salt o 2 mangoes  Instructions: o Rinse rice and soak in water for 1 hour. o Steam rice until tender. o Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt until dissolved. o Mix coconut milk with cooked rice and let sit for 10 minutes. o Serve rice with sliced mangoes. Mapo Tofu  Ingredients: o 1 block tofu o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon chili bean paste o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon rice wine o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions: o Cut tofu into cubes and set aside. o Sauté ground pork, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add chili bean paste, soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and tofu, simmer for 5 minutes. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the pan, stirring until thickened. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. Mashed Potatoes  Ingredients: o 4 potatoes o 1/2 cup milk o 1/4 cup butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Peel and dice potatoes. o Boil potatoes until tender, then drain. o Mash potatoes with milk, butter, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm. Minestrone  Ingredients: o 1 onion o 2 carrots o 2 celery stalks o 2 cloves garlic o 1 zucchini o 1 can diced tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 can cannellini beans o 1 cup pasta o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion, carrots, celery, and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced zucchini, tomatoes, and broth. o Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. o Add beans and pasta, cook until pasta is tender. o Stir in chopped basil and serve with grated Parmesan cheese. Miso Soup  Ingredients: o 4 cups dashi broth o 1/4 cup miso paste o 1/2 cup tofu o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup seaweed  Instructions: o Heat dashi broth until warm. o Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of broth, then add to the pot. o Add diced tofu and seaweed. o Simmer for 5 minutes. o Garnish with sliced green onions and serve. Moqueca de Banana  Ingredients: o 4 bananas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 2 tomatoes o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions: o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. o Stir in coconut milk, sliced bananas, salt, and pepper. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm. Msemen  Ingredients: o 2 cups flour o 1 cup semolina o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup butter  Instructions: o Mix flour, semolina, and salt in a bowl. o Add water and knead until smooth. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into thin circles. o Brush with melted butter and fold into squares. o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. o Serve warm. Muhammara  Ingredients: o 2 red bell peppers o 1/2 cup walnuts o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Roast bell peppers until charred, then peel and seed. o Blend peppers, walnuts, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, olive oil, pomegranate molasses, cumin, and salt in a food processor until smooth. o Serve with pita bread. Mutabal  Ingredients: o 2 eggplants o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash. o Blend mashed eggplant, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Naan  Ingredients: o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/2 cup warm water o 2 1/2 cups flour o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1/4 cup melted butter o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions: o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture, yogurt, and melted butter. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side. o Brush with melted butter and serve warm. Nom Du Du (Green Papaya Salad)  Ingredients: o 1 green papaya o 2 carrots o 1/4 cup peanuts o 1/4 cup cilantro o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions: o Peel and shred green papaya and carrots. o Crush peanuts and chop cilantro. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Toss shredded papaya, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Nuoc Cham  Ingredients: o 1/4 cup fish sauce o 1/4 cup lime juice o 2 tablespoons sugar o 2 cloves garlic o 1-2 Thai chilies o 1/4 cup water  Instructions: o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, minced garlic, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved. o Serve as a dipping sauce. Oi Muchim  Ingredients: o 2 cucumbers o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions: o Slice cucumbers thinly. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, gochugaru, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss cucumbers with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Onigiri (Rice Balls)  Ingredients: o 2 cups cooked sushi rice o 1/4 cup filling (salmon, pickled plum) o 1 sheet nori (seaweed)  Instructions: o Wet hands and shape rice into balls or triangles. o Make a small indentation and add filling. o Wrap with a strip of nori. o Serve immediately. Pão de Queijo  Ingredients: o 2 cups tapioca flour o 1 cup milk o 1/2 cup butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese o 2 eggs  Instructions: o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Heat milk, butter, and salt in a saucepan until boiling. o Remove from heat and stir in tapioca flour until smooth. o Let cool slightly, then mix in grated cheese and beaten eggs. o Form dough into balls and place on a baking sheet. o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Pad See Ew  Ingredients: o 8 ounces wide rice noodles o 1/2 pound chicken breast o 1 cup broccoli o 2 eggs o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions: o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté sliced chicken in vegetable oil until cooked, then set aside. o Scramble eggs in the same pan. o Add noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar, stir to combine. o Add broccoli and cooked chicken, stir-fry until heated through. o Serve warm. Pad Thai  Ingredients: o 8 ounces rice noodles o 1/2 pound shrimp o 2 eggs o 1 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup peanuts o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon lime juice o 1/4 cup green onions  Instructions: o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté shrimp in a pan until cooked, then set aside.

• 1 cup all-purpose flour • 2 tablespoons sugar • 1 teaspoon baking powder • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda • 1/4 teaspoon salt • 1 cup buttermilk • 1 large egg • 2 tablespoons melted butter • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Instructions: • In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. • In another bowl, combine buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. • Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. • Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it. • Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. • Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown. • Serve with syrup and your favorite toppings. Scrambled Eggs Ingredients: • 4 large eggs • 1/4 cup milk • Salt and pepper to taste • 1 tablespoon butter Instructions: • In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. • Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt the butter. • Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. • Cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are set but still soft. • Serve immediately. French Toast Ingredients: • 4 slices of bread • 2 large eggs • 1/2 cup milk • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract • 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon • 1 tablespoon butter Instructions: • In a shallow dish, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon. • Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, coating both sides. • Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt the butter. • Cook the bread slices until golden brown on both sides. • Serve with syrup and powdered sugar. Smoothie Bowl Ingredients: • 1 banana • 1/2 cup frozen berries • 1/2 cup Greek yogurt • 1/4 cup milk • Toppings: granola, fresh fruit, nuts, seeds Instructions: • In a blender, combine banana, frozen berries, Greek yogurt, and milk. • Blend until smooth. • Pour into a bowl and top with granola, fresh fruit, nuts, and seeds. Avocado Toast Ingredients: • 2 slices of bread • 1 ripe avocado • Salt and pepper to taste • Optional toppings: cherry tomatoes, red pepper flakes, poached egg Instructions: • Toast the bread slices. • Mash the avocado in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. • Spread the mashed avocado on the toast. • Add optional toppings if desired. Breakfast Burrito Ingredients: • 2 large eggs • 1/4 cup shredded cheese • 1/4 cup cooked sausage or bacon • 1/4 cup diced bell pepper • 1/4 cup diced onion • 1 large flour tortilla • Salsa for serving Instructions: • In a bowl, whisk the eggs and cook them in a skillet over medium heat. • Add cheese, sausage or bacon, bell pepper, and onion to the eggs. • Cook until the eggs are set and the vegetables are tender. • Place the egg mixture in the center of the tortilla and roll it up. • Serve with salsa. Oatmeal Ingredients: • 1 cup rolled oats • 2 cups water or milk • 1/4 teaspoon salt • Toppings: fresh fruit, nuts, honey, cinnamon Instructions: • In a saucepan, bring water or milk to a boil. • Add oats and salt, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. • Remove from heat and let sit for a few minutes. • Serve with your favorite toppings. Yogurt Parfait Ingredients: • 1 cup Greek yogurt • 1/2 cup granola • 1/2 cup fresh berries • Honey for drizzling Instructions: • In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and fresh berries. • Drizzle with honey. • Repeat layers if desired.
